intro: Ecdysanthera parameroides, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as along riverbanks and in humid forests. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae and is known for its adaptability to various soil types.
